nodeKeys.name: NAME
nodeKeys.comment: Name of represented object, e.g., method name (e.g. "run")

nodeKeys.name: ORDER
nodeKeys.comment: General ordering property, such that the children of each AST-node are typically numbered from 1, ..., N (this is not enforced). The ordering has no technical meaning, but is used for pretty printing and OUGHT TO reflect order in the source code

nodeKeys.name: HASH
nodeKeys.comment: Hash value of the artifact that this CPG is built from.

nodeKeys.name: INHERITS_FROM_TYPE_FULL_NAME
nodeKeys.comment: The static types a TYPE_DECL inherits from. This property is matched against the FULL_NAME of TYPE nodes and thus it is required to have at least one TYPE node for each TYPE_FULL_NAME

edgeKeys.name: ALIAS
edgeKeys.comment: Defines whether a PROPAGATE edge creates an alias

edgeKeys.name: LOCAL_NAME
edgeKeys.comment: Local name of referenced CONTAINED node. This key is deprecated.

nodeTypes.name: FILE
nodeTypes.comment: Node representing a source file - the root of the AST

nodeBaseTraits.name: AST_NODE
nodeBaseTraits.comment: Any node that can exist in an abstract syntax tree

frameworks.name: JAVA_INTERNAL
frameworks.comment: Framework facilities directly provided by Java

operatorNames.name: <operator>.pointerShift
operatorNames.comment: Shifts a pointer. In terms of CPG, the first argument is the pointer and the second argument is the index. The index selection works the same way as for indirectIndexAccess. This operator is currently only used directly by the LLVM language, but it is also used internally for C. For example, pointerShift(ptr, 7) is equivalent to &(ptr[7]). Handling of this operator is special-cased in the back-end

dispatchTypes.name: STATIC_DISPATCH
dispatchTypes.comment: For statically dispatched calls the call target is known before program execution

dispatchTypes.name: DYNAMIC_DISPATCH
dispatchTypes.comment: For dynamically dispatched calls the target is determined during runtime

evaluationStrategies.name: BY_REFERENCE
evaluationStrategies.comment: A parameter or return of a function is passed by reference which means an address is used behind the scenes

evaluationStrategies.name: BY_SHARING
evaluationStrategies.comment: Only applicable to object parameter or return values. The pointer to the object is passed by value but the object itself is not copied and changes to it are thus propagated out of the method context

evaluationStrategies.name: BY_VALUE
evaluationStrategies.comment: A parameter or return of a function passed by value which means a flat copy is used
